suppress.notes: file name: groovy-*.jar - wrong GAV match

wiremock-standalone contains an old repackaged version of Jetty which contains the following CVEs, wiremock is pinned to this version. This repackaged Jetty is used for test structures ONLY so we can safely ignore them

wrong GAV, this CVE affects a golang project named jsonpatch: https://github.com/evanphx/json-patch
coordinate: cpe:2.3:a:json-patch_project:json-patch:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:go

file name: wiremock-standalone-2.23.2.jar/META-INF/maven/com.google.guava/guava/pom.xml
Unbounded memory allocation - Ignore for the context of testing, as HTTP requests are controlled and wiremock starts/stops a server for test usage only.

file name: wiremock-standalone-2.20.0.jar/META-INF/maven/com.fasterxml.jackson.core/jackson-databind/pom.xml
wiremock-standalone repackages it's dependencies so we cannot update this version of Jackson directly. Multiple deserializes vulns have been reported. We use this lib to mock OAuth2/OIDC request/response for integration tests so we can ignore these. NOTE: this dependency is ONLY used for a test scope and will NOT cause downstream dependencies to use this version of Jackson.
Wrong GAV, lots of XML libs have a false positive for processing. This project does NOT use processing
